name: Help Needed: Palemaster melee build Level 20 Low Magic PW
author: UselessPoint

posts.author: UselessPoint
posts.content:
Hello to everyone, i'm here to ask some help developing a build for a Ravenloft Based persistent world, roleplay based, with a max level of 20. (oh, low magic, means max+2/+3 items)

I'd like to develop a Build with Palemaster (undead themed characters), but with a build focused on melee and combat (it mustn't be optimized, just an interesting build)

Right now, i was thinking something like

Bard6/Fighter4/PM10

or

Wiz6/Fight4/PM10



It would be a build based on sword and shield, good AC, heavy armor, and buffed with Still Spell casting.

The advantage and disadvantage of the two:

The Bard based:
Pro:
-Tumble skill that gives you +4 AC
-higher BAB (+1)
-level 6 bard song (+1hit,+2 damage)
-higher lore
-can level UMD
-a little more HP
-just need CHA 12

Cons:
-Just level 2 spell, so with still spell, you can use just level 1 spell



Wizard based:

Pro:
-Spell level 6, so Still Spell level 5 spell
-More buffs (ethereal visage)


Cons:
-Less hp
-Less BAB (-1)
-Less AC from tumble (cross class skill may give +2 instead of +4)
-no UMD
-Need an INT point of 16 to works
-More dependant on Rests (the server got rest restriction, so you can rest just in certain area)



So, right now, this is my approach to the Build, but i'd like some different perspective and notes about this build, even considering different classes/level

Consider that this server got Rest Restriction so it would be good even some perspective less based on spells. 


Thank you to everyone for the attention and for any possible answer.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content: With Bard6 / PM10 you will have fourth level spellslots, and if you take some Bard after the 9th PM, you will be able to select spells.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I think this is a bad idea. With all those PM levels, your AB will be so low you will have trouble hitting anything. You could squeeze one more AB into either variation if you take 6 levels of Fighter and 4 levels of the caster. Maybe somebody more practiced with casters could help salvage this idea.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
hunearo wrote:
With Bard6 / PM10 you will have fourth level spellslots, and if you take some Bard after the 9th PM, you will be able to select spells.
Sorry, I was mistaken. With Bard6 / PM10, you will have the same number of spell slots, as a lvl 11 bard, but you will only know the number of spells as a lvl 6 Bard (and the leveling order is irrelevant). This way you can use the 3rd level slots to still your 2nd level spells, or even the 4th level slots to empower them, but you will not know any 3rd or 4th level spells. AFAIK you don't need more than a base CHA of 12 as long as you can find charisma enhancing items to open and fill the higher level slots with metamagic. However you said your world is low magic, so a base value of 13 at least is advised I think.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I have tried to build something for you, but I end up cutting down on the PM levels all the time. Pre epic PM is bad for AB in a combat build, and bad for spell casting in a mage build. In a "spell-sword" It ends up crippling both parts that are hard pressed in the first place.
My advice if you want to keep some playability, is to build a straight wizard, play it as a melee mage in combat and role-play it as a necromancer preoccupied with bone-lore. You can do the same thing with cleric and get a character with much stronger melee presence.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: Agree with Mick here, PM 10 in level 20 cap is just bad :D

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Welcome Aboard the ECB Guild's express!  Quite a request for your first one.  Not the worst idea I've read but it ranks right up there.  Anyways, to the business at hand..
I agree with all that has been already been intimated by others about this notion, but if you held a gun to my head and commanded... BUILD, dammit, BUILD!... this is about the best I could concoct without knowledge of possible exploits on the server:
Spoiler [+]

Fighter 6/ Bard 4/ PM 10, any non-lawful non-good Dwarf

STR: 17 (22)
DEX: 13
CON: 16
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 6

01 - Ftr(1): Dodge, WF
02 - Ftr(2): Blind Fight
03 - Ftr(3): Expertise
04 - Ftr(4): STR+1 (18), WS
05 - Ftr(5)
06 - Ftr(6): PA, Cleave
07 - Brd(1)
08 - Brd(2): STR+1 (19)
09 - Brd(3): Toughness (or Lingering Song)
10 - PM(1)
11 - PM(2)
12 - PM(3): STR+1 (20), KD
13 - PM(4)
14 - PM(5)
15 - PM(6): ImpCrit
16 - PM(7): STR+1 (21)
17 - PM(8)
18 - PM(9): IKD
19 - PM(10)
20 - Brd(4): STR+1 (22)

HP max: 242
Saves F/W/R (vs spells): 16/12/10 (23/19/17)
Add'l saves:  Poison +2
BAB: 14 (3 APR)
AB (max, naked): 21 (mundane martial), 15 (ranged)
AB 21 + 6 taunt max + 1 song = AB 28 max mundane
AC (naked/mundane fplate+tower only): 21/32 +1 Dodge

Skills: 100 Discipline 23(29), Perform 11(9), Spellcraft 23(25), Taunt 23(21), Tumble 20(21)



My advice: Dump the idea of spellcasting altogether.  DCs will be pitiful, penetration horrible and buffs easily dispelled so stick with arcane scrolls which can often use much higher caster levels than this toon will have.  If you feel some UMD is worth it (no more than net UMD 5 or 10 needed for divine items, if that much on low magic), you'll need to sacrifice some Discipline.  Play your mandolin for a slight boost to attack, dmg & saves and be satisfied with that much.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: What happens when I try to build the Bard/Fightrer/PM, is that I end up with Bard16/Fighter4, almost identical to Kail's Battle skald.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: That's a better singing meleer, Mick, especially with the curse synergy in place.  But no crit immunity, a need to keep shuffling armor/shield for pre-combat buffing and lack of metamagic to take advantage of ability boosts and short duration spells like Haste, Silence and Wounding Whispers.  It's nostalgic to be reminded of Kail's bias for those WoG crafted wands as well.  Never travel away from home without 'em.  Brings back memories.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Well Hip, I replaced Craft Wand with Still Spell, dropped Artist and took Improved Knockdown, and replaced some of the UMD with Listen. That way Perform ends at 29, so you will need a minor boost to Charisma, or a skill enhancing item to be able to sing the level 16 song properly.
But my point: It is no longer a Pale Master. IMO Crit immunity only reaches its potential in an epic environment with Dev Crit. The PM AC bonus is normally not worth the pre epic loss of BAB. The summons and once per day touch attack have limited value.
